action.action-desc: Mr. Faso (for himself and Mr. Gonzalez of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To exempt properties located in flood hazard areas that are participating in an approved buy-out program from the mandatory purchase requirement under the National Flood Insurance Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Flooded Homeowner Financial Relief Act of 2018.

section.header: Exemption of buy-out properties from mandatory purchase requirement
section.text: Subsection (c) of section 102 of the Flood Disaster Protection Act of 1973 (42 U.S.C. 4012a(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, flood insurance shall not be required for any residential propertyâ€”

subparagraph.text: that is located in an area having special flood hazards; and

for which a binding commitment has been made to acquire the property, demolish the residential structure located on the property, and designate the property for open-space use, under a Federal, State, local, or other program for such buy-outs that meets such requirements as the Administrator shall require to ensure that such open-space use is accomplished.
